background: An aquarium hosts shows featuring otters and dolphins, each performing tricks for treats. There are constraints on the number of performers and treats available.
constraints: Number of otters used is non-negative
Number of dolphins used is non-negative
At least MinDolphins dolphins must be used
At most MaxOtterProportion of the performers can be otters
The total treats used cannot exceed TotalTreats
objective: Maximize the total number of tricks performed by otters and dolphins
description: An aquarium does shows using otters and dolphins. An otter will do \param{OtterTricks} tricks at a time and requires \param{OtterTreats} treats to do so. A dolphin will do \param{DolphinTricks} trick at a time and requires \param{DolphinTreats} treats to do so. Since dolphins are more popular, at least \param{MinDolphins} dolphins must be used and at most \param{MaxOtterProportion} of the performers can be otters. If the aquarium only has \param{TotalTreats} treats available, maximize the total number of tricks that can be performed.

parameters.definition: Number of tricks performed by an otter at a time
Number of treats required by an otter to perform its tricks
Number of tricks performed by a dolphin at a time
Number of treats required by a dolphin to perform its trick
Minimum number of dolphins that must be used
Maximum proportion of performers that can be otters
